00034 #if defined(AT91SAM7X256)
00035   #define EEPROM_DATA_MEMORY_SIZE 0x400u
00036 #elif defined(ATMEGA1281) || defined(ATMEGA2561) || defined(ATMEGA1284) || defined(AT90USB1287) \
00037    || defined(ATXMEGA256A3) || defined(ATMEGA128RFA1)

00039 #elif defined(ATXMEGA128A1)
00040   #define EEPROM_DATA_MEMORY_SIZE 0x800u

00047 /**************************************************************************/
00050 typedef struct
00051 {
00053   uint16_t address;
00055   uint8_t *data;
00057   uint16_t length;
00058 } HAL_EepromParams_t;
00059 
00060 /******************************************************************************
00061                    Prototypes section
00062 ******************************************************************************/
00063 /******************************************************************************
00064 \brief Reads a number of bytes defined by HAL_EepromParams_t from the EEPROM.
00065 \param[in]
00066   param - address of HAL_EepromParams_t structure. \n
00067   fields of structure set by user: \n
00068   address - eeprom address \n
00069   data - pointer to data memory \n
00070   length - number of bytes
00071 \param[in]
00072   readDone - pointer to the function that will notify about reading completion.
00073 \return
00074   0 - success, \n
00075   -1 - the number of bytes to write is too large, \n
00076   -2 - the previous EEPROM request is not completed yet.
00077 ******************************************************************************/
00078 int HAL_ReadEeprom(HAL_EepromParams_t *params, void (*readDone)());
00079 
00080 /******************************************************************************
00081 \brief Writes a number of bytes defined by HAL_EepromParams_t to EEPROM.
00082 By writeDone parameter user can control if write operation will be asynchronous
00083 or synchronous.
00084 \param[in]
00085   param - address of HAL_EepromParams_t structure. \n
00086   fields of structure set by user: \n
00087   address - eeprom address \n
00088   data - pointer to data memory \n
00089   length - number of bytes
00090 \param[in]
00091   writeDone - pointer to the function that will notify about reading completion. \n
00092   Only for avr: \n
00093   if writeDone is NULL write operation will be synchronous.
00094 \return
00095   0 - success, \n
00096   -1 - the number of bytes to write is too large, \n
00097   -2 - the previous EEPROM request is not completed yet.
00098 ******************************************************************************/
00099 int HAL_WriteEeprom(HAL_EepromParams_t *params, void (*writeDone)());
00100 
00101 /**************************************************************************/
00108 bool HAL_IsEepromBusy(void);
